body_html:
Hi, I can't seem to find a link to the notebook, is there a place I can see more of the code? In particular, where is the make_one_shot_iterator being created?

We used make_one_shot_iterator in mirrored strategy earlier which would cause this issue and it was fixed around Apr 18: 03d18ae#diff-17d893fed7bb36da99ce6c80d933d00b)

If I have the timing of 1.8 right, this fix may not have made it to 1.8 release. So if this is indeed the root cause, if you try the nightly builds, you should not see this issue. Would it be possible for you to test with the tf-nightly-gpu?
Also, have you already tested without mirrored strategy and it works fine then?

If I have the timing of 1.8 right, this fix may not have made it to 1.8 release. So if this is indeed the root cause, if you try the nightly builds, you should not see this issue. Would it be possible for you to test with the tf-nightly-gpu?
Also, have you already tested without mirrored strategy and it works fine then?
body:
Hi, I can't seem to find a link to the notebook, is there a place I can see more of the code? In particular, where is the make_one_shot_iterator being created? 

We used make_one_shot_iterator in mirrored strategy earlier which would cause this issue and it was fixed around Apr 18: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/03d18ae232c3cff4c56d1efec7bf29f9b16c4f68#diff-17d893fed7bb36da99ce6c80d933d00b)

If I have the timing of 1.8 right, this fix may not have made it to 1.8 release. So if this is indeed the root cause, if you try the nightly builds, you should not see this issue. Would it be possible for you to test with the tf-nightly-gpu?
Also, have you already tested without mirrored strategy and it works fine then?
